reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Organisational Support for UN Women Finland

description.narrative: Finland National Committee for UN Women is a non-governmental organization with consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC). The national committee supports the mission of UN Women the United Nations agency for gender equality and women?s rights and is one of the few associations in Finland specialised in women's and girl's rights. The association coordinates the 1325 Network in Finland consisting of non-governmental organizations and independent researches as well as e xperts that work for the promotion of human rights and equality. Finland National Committee for UN Women applies the organisational support for the general activities as well for its development communication and global education activities.In 2021-2022 th e aim is to strengthen UN Women's awareness in Finland and to increase its role as a civil society actor. The measures include coordination of Generation Equality -campaign which brings together actors from various sectors to achieve gender equality improv ed member coordination and activation of local associations national coordination of the 1325 network and communication work. In 2021-2022 the focus of communication activities will include in particular campaigning to end violence against women the prom otion of the role of men in promoting equality promoting women's empowerment in business and work-life and innovation and technology (Generation Equality).UN Women Finland has applied for organisational support for 2021-2022 for a total of ? 590 376.

Finland National Committee for UN Women is a non-governmental organization with consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC). The national committee supports the mission of UN Women the United Nations agency for gender equality and women?s rights and is one of the few associations in Finland specialised in women's and girl's rights. The association coordinates the 1325 Network in Finland consisting of non-governmental organizations and independent researches as well as e xperts that work for the promotion of human rights and equality. Finland National Committee for UN Women applies the organisational support for the general activities as well for its development communication and global education activities.In 2021-2022 th e aim is to strengthen UN Women's awareness in Finland and to increase its role as a civil society actor. The measures include coordination of Generation Equality -campaign which brings together actors from various sectors to achieve gender equality improv ed member coordination and activation of local associations national coordination of the 1325 network and communication work. In 2021-2022 the focus of communication activities will include in particular campaigning to end violence against women the prom otion of the role of men in promoting equality promoting women's empowerment in business and work-life and innovation and technology (Generation Equality).UN Women Finland has applied for organisational support for 2021-2022 for a total of ? 590 376.

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is a secondary priority area in this activity
